parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Sounds

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enable and disable radio messages to be heard and shown in the left lower corner of the screen. This command can be helpful during cutscenes.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''enableRadio''' state

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> state: [[Boolean]] - true to enable the radio, false to disable it

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[enableRadio]] [[false]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setSpeaker]], [[disableConversation]], [[enableSentences]], [[showSubtitles]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 7 August, 2008</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command doesn't disable text-chat in multiplayer.


<dd class="notedate">Posted on 11 September, 2008 </dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:beta|beta]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Does not affect VON.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
